main_text:
Anti-Absolutism
2. Anti-Absolutism
Nelson Goodman’s philosophy synthesizes German/Austrian Logical
Empiricism, as developed and practiced by philosophers like Rudolf
Carnap and Carl Hempel, with American Pragmatism of the kind practiced
and advocated by C.I. Lewis. Goodman, however, departs from both
traditions considerably. As we will see, he departs from Lewis’s
pragmatism in dismissing the idea of an indubitable given in
experience. He departs from logical empiricism in giving up a
principled analytic/synthetic distinction.
